question.qText: Doge Loredon chose the pomegranate motif on his gown for all of the following reasons EXCEPT

aBtn.aText: that the Doge wanted to show that he ruled over a prosperous empire
that the Doge wanted viewers to associate him with Jesus’s resurrection
that as a Renaissance ruler, the Doge wanted to choose a symbol that had both Classical and contemporary meanings
that the Doge liked its associations with chastity because portrayed him as a moderate, moral leader
that the Doge wanted his portrait to show that his reign would bring regeneration and rebirth to the Venetian empire

question.qText: The painting of the Doge shows that Giovanni Bellini can be considered an Italian Renaissance artist for all the following reasons EXCEPT

aBtn.aText: that he signed his name prominently on the painting
that he observed every detail of the Doge’s face and garments with almost photographic realism
that he attempted to show the Doge’s wisdom and character in the portrait
that he had the Doge pose almost frontally instead of in profile
that the painting is a masterpiece of mathematical perspective

question.qText: The portrayal of Elizabeth I as a young woman in a portrait painted when she was 67 years old can be explained by all of the following reasons EXCEPT

aBtn.aText: that Elizabeth was vain, hated the idea of ageing and wanted her portrait to show her as a strong and ageless ruler
that Elizabeth didn’t want her portrait to remind people that she might die soon without naming an heir
that the artist who painted her portrait was afraid that if he painted her as she really looked she would have him arrested
that her age was less important in the portrait than the symbolism of Elizabeth as a wise ruler
that Elizabeth believed her portraits would survive long after her death as symbols of her reign and she had herself portrayed as she wanted to be remembered

question.qText: All of the following can be said of these two portraits EXCEPT

aBtn.aText: that the artists were chosen by the rulers for their skill and reputation
that the final product was a result of collaboration between the artists and the rulers
that the artists probably admired their subjects and wanted them to approve of the finished work
that the artists took the commissions just for the money
that the artists knew that these portraits would be widely seen and wanted to make sure they showcased their talents to the fullest
